result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joseph D. Clark Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph D. Clark Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court finds that the deft successfully completed probation.  Criminal charge of ct 1 in file 15CF74 is dismissed on State motion.  Co. Ordinance citation P439956 for possession of THC filed.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Court imposes $143.80 total fine/costs, 30 days to pay, or civil judgment.  Court finds that the deft is not eligible for expunction on ct 2.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court withholds entry of judgment on ct 1 and allows hold open agreement to go forward; on count 2 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions.  RH 4/26/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  15CF74/15TR833/834/835.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Court recuses from these cases; well acquainted with the deft's father.  Clerk contacted CSM - tab pulled for Branch 6.  NTBS of next court date.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Bill Michel. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-19-15 @ 10:20am. Jury selection on 4-27-15 @ 9:00am. Atty. Michel has a jury trial in Br. 8 on that date, also. Bond continued.

113 p.m.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Michel.  Clk:  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 2/12/15 @ 9 a.m. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Drug Paraphernalia.
961.41(3g)(e) -Poss of THC 2nd & Subsequent   961.573(1) -Poss of Drug Paraphernalia
